definitions.title: demonstr.
definitions.body: Hb Hab 1:11 [[זוּ כׂחוֹ]] this his strength, Ps 12:8 [[מִן־הַדּוֹר זוּ]] (unusual, for [[הַזֶּה]]), Ps 62:12 [[שְׁתַּיִם־זוּ]] [[שָׁמַעָתִּי]] these two things &c. (but: better (Wickes:Post. Acc. 64) [[âשְׁתַּיִם åזוּ]] two things (are there) which &c.: v.

definitions.title: relative
definitions.body: , Ex 15:13 [[עַם־זוּ גׇאָָלְתָּ]] the people which thou hast redeemed, v:Ex 15:16, Is 42:24 [[זוּ חָטָאנוּ לוֹ]] against whom we sinned, Is 43:21, Ps 9:16 (fem.) [[רֶשֶׁת־שזוּ טָ֝פָמנוּ]] so Ps 31:5, Ps 10:2, Ps 17:9 (with a plural antecedent) [[מִפְּנֵי רְשָׁעִים זוּ שַׁדּוּנִי]], Ps 32:8, Ps 68:29 (thou) who hast wrought for us ! Ps 142:4, Ps 143:8. To most of these passages the remark made under [[זה]]

respecting the intention of the punctuators also applies: comp. De on Ps 9:16. (Cf. d-uw, used as an indeclin. relat. pron. = 0’al=d-iy in the Ṭayyite dialect: thus 0’aty 9lyhm d-w 0’ty there has come upon them that which has come: nh.n d-w f9ln0 kd-0 it is we who have done this. See Schu:Hariri Cons. ii. 75, Thes:406, W:AG. i. 347, e, Lane:p. 986, Fl:Kl. Schr. i. p. 359.)
